hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a downside break below the 20-day Bollinger Lower Band (2 std) on >1.5x average volume signals high-probability transition to BEAR regime, with mean reversion failing.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed volatility often precede directional breaks. Low volatility suggests complacency; downside break on elevated volume indicates institutional selling overcoming support. Bear transitions typically begin with volatility expansion from compressed states.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes below 20-day Bollinger Lower Band (2 std)
Volume on break day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns above 20-day SMA for 2 consecutive closes
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price rallies >8% from entry without reclaiming SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 14 days without BEAR regime confirmation (VIX term structure inversion)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >70% of such breaks see price recover above Bollinger Lower Band within 5 days and resume neutral range trading without VIX term structure inversion.
